title: Count Users by Age Group
markdown:
# Count Users by Age Group

Write a SQL query to count the number of users for each `age`. Return the result ordered by `age` in ascending order.

### Table Schema
| Column | Type    | Description |
|--------|---------|-------------|
| id     | INTEGER | Primary Key |
| name   | TEXT    | User Name   |
| age    | INTEGER | User Age    |

### Example
**Input:**
```
+----+-------+-----+
| id | name  | age |
+----+-------+-----+
| 1  | Alice | 30  |
| 2  | Bob   | 20  |
| 3  | Charlie| 30 |
+----+-------+-----+
```

**Output:**
```
+-----+-------+
| age | count |
+-----+-------+
| 20  | 1     |
| 30  | 2     |
+-----+-------+
```

testCases.solutionSql: SELECT age, COUNT(*) as count FROM users GROUP BY age ORDER BY age ASC;
